item.title: A global glacial ocean state estimate constrained by upper-ocean temperature proxies
Connecting ocean tracers to global climate
item.description: We are using the MITgcm adjoint to infer atmospheric changes (like wind stress amplitudes, in red) that change abyssal watermass distributions in ways suggested by paleo data.

item.title: Inferring the glacial ocean state from models + data
item.description: Fitting numerical models to observations paints a physically consistent picture of the ocean 20,000 years ago.

item.title: Reconstructing Atlantic Ocean heat content over the last 1000 years
item.description: I am extending the Last Millennium Reanalysis to include ocean observations and determine what we can – and can’t – say about internal climate variability over the last 1000 years.

item.title: Signal and noise in paleoclimate records
item.description: Using proxy data is like playing a game of ‘telephone’ with past climate – sometimes the information gets garbled. I am working to quantify errors arising from proxy sampling procedures.

item.title: Tools for accelerating tracer simulations
item.description: Simulating ocean tracers is computationally expensive. New online extrapolation and preconditioning techniques allow us to estimate equilibria in a fraction of the time.
